class entities.Enemy(game, pos, size)[source]ÔÉÅ

Bases: PhysicsEntity

Represents an enemy entity with specific behaviors like patrolling or attacking the player.

Inherits from PhysicsEntity and adds enemy-specific attributes and methods.

walkingÔÉÅ

Counter for controlling patrolling behavior or other

Type:

int

movement patterns.
render(surf, offset=(0, 0))[source]ÔÉÅ

Renders the enemy entity on the specified surface, adjusted by the given offset and with additional enemy-specific visuals.

Parameters:

  • surf (pygame.Surface) ‚Äì The surface to draw the enemy on.

  • offset (tuple) ‚Äì The offset to apply to the enemy‚Äôs position

  • drawing. (when)

update(tilemap, movement=(0, 0))[source]ÔÉÅ

Updates the enemy‚Äôs state, including patrolling behavior, attacks, and interactions with the player.

Parameters:

  • tilemap ‚Äì The tilemap object the enemy interacts with.

  • movement (tuple) ‚Äì The movement input for the enemy as (dx, dy).

class entities.PhysicsEntity(game, e_type, pos, size)[source]ÔÉÅ

Bases: object

A base class for entities in the game that interact physically with the world, including players, enemies, and other movable objects.

gameÔÉÅ

Reference to the main game object for accessing global resources and settings.

typeÔÉÅ

The type of the entity, used to distinguish between

Type:

str

different kinds of entities.

The position of the entity in the game world as [x, y].

Type:

list

The size of the entity as (width, height).

Type:

tuple

velocityÔÉÅ

The current velocity of the entity as [vx, vy].

Type:

list

A dictionary tracking collision states in four

Type:

dict

Type:

Type:

Creates a pygame.Rect object representing the entity‚Äôs current position and size.

render(surf, offset=(0, 0))[source]ÔÉÅ

Renders the entity on the specified surface, adjusted by the given offset and flipped based on the entity‚Äôs direction.

Parameters:

  • surf (pygame.Surface) ‚Äì The surface to draw the entity on.

  • offset (tuple) ‚Äì The offset to apply to the entity‚Äôs position when drawing.

set_action(action)[source]ÔÉÅ

Sets the current action of the entity, updating its animation accordingly.

Parameters:

action (str) ‚Äì The new action to set for the entity.

update(tilemap, movement=(0, 0))[source]ÔÉÅ
Updates the entity‚Äôs state, including position, velocity, collisions,

and animation based on movement input and tilemap interactions.

Parameters:

  • movement (tuple) ‚Äì The movement input for the entity as (dx, dy).

class entities.Player(game, pos, size)[source]ÔÉÅ

Bases: PhysicsEntity

Represents the player entity with specific behaviors like jumping, dashing, and interaction with game elements.

Inherits from PhysicsEntity and adds player-specific attributes and methods.

air_timeÔÉÅ

Counter for tracking how long the player has

Type:

int

been in the air
Type:

for jump control

jumpsÔÉÅ

The number of available jumps (for double jump

Type:

int

or similar mechanics).
wall_slideÔÉÅ

Indicates whether the player is currently sliding down a wall.

Type:

bool

dashingÔÉÅ

Counter for dash action, controlling its behavior

Type:

int

and duration.
dash()[source]ÔÉÅ

Initiates the player‚Äôs dash action, providing a burst of speed and potentially passing through obstacles.

jump()[source]ÔÉÅ

Initiates the player‚Äôs jump, affecting velocity and potentially enabling wall jumps or double jumps.

rect()[source]ÔÉÅ

Overrides the base method to provide a rectangle representing the player‚Äôs bounds for collision detection.

Returns:

The rectangle representing the player‚Äôs bounds.

Return type:

pygame.Rect

update(tilemap, movement=(0, 0))[source]ÔÉÅ
Updates the player‚Äôs state, including movement, jump, dash, and

interactions with the game world.

Parameters:

  • tilemap ‚Äì The tilemap object the player interacts with.

  • movement (tuple) ‚Äì The movement input for the player as (dx, dy).
